title: Winter Snow Storm Slams New England
summary: Resume Subscription. A severe winter storm overwhelmed New England with heavy snow and hurricane-force gusts, but light fluffy snow and a weekend that kept people off the roads meant that damage didn't appear extensive for a storm of such magnitude.

title: Tom Brady Plans to Retire After 22 NFL Seasons, Reports Say-but He's Staying Quiet
summary: The 44-year-old quarterback has yet to address reports about his future. Tom Brady won seven Super Bowls, broke passing records and gave the illusion he could play forever. Now the legendary quarterback will soon say it's over, according to reports.

title: Italy Opts to Keep Same Leaders, Averting Political Chaos
summary: Italy's fragmented political class re-elects Sergio Mattarella as head of state and keeps Mario Draghi as head of government after week of disarray. ROME-Italian lawmakers re-elected President Sergio Mattarella as head of state, ending a week of quarreling over other possible candidates that threatened to undermine the stability of the government.

title: Europe Brings a Lawsuit to a China Fight
summary: Beijing punishes tiny Lithuania, and the EU sends in the lawyers.. Sometimes we wonder what world European leaders think they're living in. The European Union on Thursday responded to China's trade assault against its member state Lithuania by filing a . . . complaint at the World Trade Organization. Talk about bringing a quill pen to a gun fight.

title: Turkey's Erdogan Fires Statistics Chief After Record Inflation
summary: President also appoints another member of ruling party as justice minister. ISTANBUL-Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan replaced the head of the state statistics agency weeks after it reported record inflation, which added to anger in the country over its economic woes, and appointed another member of the ruling party as justice minister.

title: What Is a Bomb Cyclone? A Winter Storm Explained
summary: Storm brings heavy snowfall alongside blizzard-like winds that can be destructive. A major winter storm has touched down in the Northeast, delivering blizzard-like conditions that could knock out power and bring upheaval to both small and major cities.

title: A God Takes a Break From Mischief
summary: In 'Reclining Pan,' a repurposed block of marble celebrates the deity's carnal excesses.

title: The Other Nazi Olympics and the Dawn of U.S. Boycott Talk
summary: Six months ahead of 1936 Berlin, Germany hosted the Winter Games. Some Americans voiced alarm.. A few months before the Bavarian resort of Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Germany, hosted the 1936 Winter Olympics, signs posted in area parks proclaimed "Jews Not Admitted."

title: Why 30 Years of Defense Consolidation May Be at an End
summary: Antitrust regulators' attempts to stop Lockheed Martin's acquisition of Aerojet Rocketdyne spells the end of the defense merger party. After three decades, defense may not be a buyer's market anymore.

title: Whatever You Drove in College Isn't as Cool as His Firetruck
summary: Recent graduate Sean Robinson and his retired 1982 Mack CF make coffee runs, hang Christmas lights and rescue Frisbees from trees. Sean Robinson, 22, a Chicago-based automotive restoration specialist, on his 1982 Mack CF firetruck, as told to A.J. Baime.

title: Parenting Is Lonely. Here's How to Find and Keep Friends in 2022
summary: Resume Subscription. Loneliness is a reality for many of us, now more than ever. After last week's column on the loneliness felt by moms in middle age, my inbox began overflowing with emails from readers, many of whom asked for solutions.

title: Ashleigh Barty Wins Women's Australian Open on Her Home Turf
summary: She defeats American Danielle Collins to become first Australian man or woman to be champion since 1978. The most memorable tournament run of Ashleigh Barty's life lasted barely 7.5 hours.

title: Deadly Mining Disaster Still Tests Vale Three Years Later
summary: Resume Subscription. NOVA LIMA, Brazil-Three years after Vale SA's Brumadinho disaster, the fallout from the dam collapse that killed 270 people still looms large over the mining giant.

title: Mining Towns Live in Fear of Another Deadly Dam Collapse
summary: Resume Subscription. BRUMADINHO, Brazil-Nestled in the verdant countryside of southeastern Brazil, Brumadinho was a town where everybody knew each other, resident Daiane Gonçalves said. Now it is a place where everybody knows someone who died in the mining tragedy.

title: What CEOs Are Saying About Inflation
summary: Leaders from Apple, McDonald's, Southwest and other companies share what they are seeing and doing about rising prices. This is what some of the world's corporate leaders said on their quarterly earnings calls this week about what they are seeing and doing about inflation.

title: Russia Presses Buildup Near Ukraine as Diplomacy Falters
summary: Kremlin's options range from full-scale attack and seizure of territory to political coercion aimed at undermining government in Kyiv. Russia pressed ahead this week with its military buildup near Ukraine, giving it the capability to seize swaths of the country's territory as the already-slim diplomatic prospects to avert a conflict appeared to narrow further.

title: Slash on the New, Drama-Free Guns N' Roses
summary: Resume Subscription. LOS ANGELES-At the peak of Guns N' Roses mania, lead guitarist Slash was a train wreck within a train wreck. The band showed up late for concerts, night after night. A few times, fans rioted. Slash drank so much he was eventually given six weeks to live. He and Axl Rose fought and didn't perform onstage together for 23 years.

title: Texas GOP Governor Faces Backlash Over National Guard Deployment
summary: Gov. Greg Abbott faces challenges from fellow Republicans and Democrats over pay problems and poor morale among National Guardsmen. Texas Republican Gov. Greg Abbott is being blamed by GOP opponents and Democrats for bungling the deployment of thousands of National Guard troops to the border under his signature program Operation Lone Star after a recent spate of suicides among the troops.

title: 'Sherlock Holmes in 221 Objects' Review: Magnificent Obsession
summary: A collector's stunning holding of works related to Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's famed detective is now on view at the Grolier Club.

title: In Italy, No Dolce Vita for the Unvaccinated
summary: As travel and other restrictions tighten on Italians who aren't inoculated against Covid-19, workarounds include flying abroad to reach a domestic destination. MILAN-Italy wanted to make life difficult for people who refused to get vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: Uproar in Israel Over Police Snooping Renews Privacy Debate
summary: Authorities launch an investigation, consider legislative changes to modernize Israel's cyber laws. TEL AVIV-For years, governments around the world used Israeli company NSO Group's software to spy on journalists, activists and dissidents, prompting the U.S. to blacklist it. Now, a firestorm has erupted here over whether the company's tools were used to illegally monitor Israelis.

title: Amazon, UPS, Exxon Are on Deck to Report Earnings in Coming Week
summary: Inflation and supply chains have been common topics on companies' quarterly conference calls. Amazon.com Inc., United Parcel Service Inc. and Exxon Mobil Corp. are among the companies headlining another busy earnings week, as investors continue to digest company comments about supply-chain challenges and inflation.

title: 'Fashioning an Empire: Safavid Textiles From the Museum of Islamic Art, Doha' Review: The Fabric of a Dynasty
summary: A focused show in Washington, mostly on loan from Qatar, offers the chance to explore a rich sliver of Iranian history.. Washington

title: Biden Had Strategy to Beat Covid-19. Then Variants Arrived.
summary: Resume Subscription. WASHINGTON-President Biden took office with a detailed plan to battle Covid-19 by accelerating vaccinations, reopening schools and selling a massive stimulus proposal to help embattled state and local officials rein in the virus.

title: U.S., EU Sanctions on Russia Could Ensnarl Western Oil Companies
summary: Washington and Brussels aren't targeting oil or gas exports, but broader restrictions could still hit firms with big business in Russia. LONDON-Some of the West's biggest oil companies could find themselves in the crosshairs of sanctions now being drafted by their home governments against Russia.

title: Wall Street's Green Push Exposes New Conflicts of Interest
summary: Auditors, bond raters and others aim to profit by both judging and advising companies on their ESG scores. The booming business of green finance is being led by an unlikely group of companies that sits at the heart of the financial system.

title: Ukraine's 'Weekend Army' Trains as Last Defense Against Russia
summary: Citizen-soldiers, fired by patriotism, try to overcome past struggles to get ready and get organized. KYIV, Ukraine-In a forest one frigid recent morning, this country's last line of defense was training for the nightmare scenario of a Russian invasion reaching deep into the interior.

title: Tesla Is the Latest Entrant Into the Carpool Karaoke Competition
summary: EV maker introduces TeslaMic as it tries to catch up to local rivals. Chinese consumers on Friday gave an ovation to Tesla Inc., a new seller of karaoke microphones for singing in cars.

title: Even at College, Our Children Are Home
summary: Texting and social media allow today's students to stay connected to family and old friends in a way unimaginable to previous generations. I sometimes forget that my daughter has left for college. She Facetimes me on her way from the library to the gym. I see a small portion of her head, blue sky behind her, headphones dangling from an ear, part of a cup of coffee. She texts me updates on her failing quest to find the right edition of "The Waste Land" for one of her classes. I am still part of the dailiness of her life in a way that I am quite sure my mother was not in mine when I left for college in the last century.

summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: The FTC's New Antitrust Argument Against Tech Giants
summary: Federal Trade Commission chief Lina Khan has developed an innovative way to frame the issue. Whether she has the tools to see it through remains to be seen.. For years, activists, lawmakers, lobbying groups, think tanks and most Americans have agreed something should be done about giant tech companies' power. With minor exceptions, no one has figured out how to do it.

title: The Mentors Who Helped Ulta Beauty's Unlikely CEO Succeed
summary: Mary Dillon worked as a waitress, housecleaner and tutor to pay for college. Her path eventually led her to the top job at a major U.S. retailer.. In Personal Board of Directors, top business leaders talk about the people they turn to for advice, and how those people have shaped their perspective and helped them succeed. Previous installments from the series are here.

title: Joni Mitchell Removes Music From Spotify in Support of Neil Young
summary: 'Irresponsible people are spreading lies,' the 'Blue' folk singer wrote. Joni Mitchell said she decided to remove all of her music from Spotify Technology SA in a move supporting Neil Young's crusade against what he deems misinformation spread on Joe Rogan's podcast.

title: Pentagon Warns Russia Could Seize Ukrainian Cities, While Kyiv Pleads for Calm
summary: The U.S. defense secretary said Putin has multiple options but that a diplomatic solution remained possible. The Pentagon warned Friday that Russia has amassed sufficient combat power to take cities and substantial swaths of territory in Ukraine, whose leaders warned the U.S. was overstating the Russian threat.

title: Whirlpool, Kroger, Apple: Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Here are seven major companies whose stocks moved on the week's news. Whirlpool Corp.

title: Secret's Out: These Caribbean Resorts Are (Relatively) Affordable Finds
summary: From the Dominican Republic to Jamaica, 6 under-the-radar Caribbean retreats with room rates as mild as the climate. FOR ANYONE eager to thaw out this winter on a sun-drenched beach in the Caribbean, a word of caution: Brace yourself for sticker shock. Room rates at the luxury hotels have risen considerably since before the pandemic, nearly 25% in some cases, said Melissa Pugh, a Jet World Travel consultant who specializes in high-end Caribbean vacations. "Covid was very expensive for a lot of hotels and still is," she explained, attributing the price hike, in part, to staffing shortages and enhanced cleaning and safety protocols. Yet, even the soaring costs aren't enough to quell demand, and the region's most popular luxury resorts are rapidly booking up.

title: Alabama Asks Supreme Court to Reinstate New Congressional Map
summary: Case seen as preview of intense year of election litigation. WASHINGTON-Alabama on Friday asked the Supreme Court to reinstate the new congressional map its Republican-controlled legislature drew to reflect 2020 census data after a lower court blocked its use for discriminating against Black voters.
